p: Due to its numerous properties, eugenol has found a wide range of uses in many areas of life. In addition, because of the growing interest in unconventional, traditional medicines that contain natural ingredients, it remains an important object of scientific research as a potential component of various medicinal products, including those intended for treating human lung cancer [ 3, 4]. Isoeugenol derivatives have become a popular subject of research due to their fungicidal and insecticidal properties, because they exhibit greater antimicrobial activity than eugenol [ 2]. This study reviews the current state of knowledge regarding the multidirectional action and application of eugenol and its derivatives and recent research into these compounds.
